rComments: Proff. Heer is hard but she knows what she is talking about.  This class really cleared up some basic art history theory.

Lisa Heer is the best lecturer Ive had. She is really passionate and extremely knowledgable. She is a fast lecturer so you've got be quick with note taking. Her tests are hard if you dont go to class, but most of the questions are about content and it is obvious which pieces you will have to know.

This was one of the worst classes I've taken so far.  Lectures were terrible, she was late almost everyday, but if a student left early she would get angry and completely interrupt the class.  The textbook was a waste of money, it didn't help at all. Unfair tests that required students to memorize an unreasonable amount of info.
Not the easiest Professor to follow, but she manage to get some very impiortant concepts covered that arn't usually done in a intro class. Very interesting.

so what if you had to work hard in this class! It was up to you to study for tests and write simple 3 page essays, hell im a first year and this was my first quarter. great teacher, really into what she teaches. study guides super helpful. everything on paper was noted in class. :)

Everything I learned was from section or independently researching what I believed would be on the test. Lisa Heer has no business lecturing a class when her lectures were emotionless, pompous and too quick. She had a consistent lack of respect for students, shown both in how she addressed the students and how tardy she was.

my favorite class in three years at ucsc. i love this woman. go to lecture and listen, memorize as you go, and it'll be (atleast i thought) an easy A. Will definitely try my best to take another class with her. I think most of the class was pissed that it required work or (for HAVC majors) was too basic to keep them interested. SHE IS AMAZING

WORST class and WORST professor I've had in 3 years at UCSC. Hard to follow, unfriendly, tests are INSANE. Should be an interesting subject but she ruins it. Completely unreasonable and unenjoyable.  Gives the most disjointed lectures -- I had to research everything for the test myself because lectures were so unhelpful.  DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!

Lisa Heer isn't bad. she does speak quickly but she knows what she's talking about. People complain about the tests, but they are strait forward and should be easy to take. It takes time to study, but you know exactly what to study for! if you do poorly on the tests or papers it your own fault. Easy and a interesting class.

unclear,self-righteous,pompous professor who enjoys laughing at own esoteric jokes,cutting off students if they dare question her teaching methods or want something repeated in class, finds it impossible to get to class on time, but doesn't mind wasting yours to finish rambling nonsense about high and mighty Italy, screeching voice of doom&pain!

H=Heer=Horrible.Hypocritical and self-rightious.Wont allow late papers,condemns people coming in late, when she herself is 10 mins late on average.You have to write down everything she says because she refuses to use notes in class.Test are unreasonably hard.Has a very annoying voice & thinks she's the funniest thing on earth.DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!!

I dont understand why people would not find her clear, but oh well. I got everything down in lecture in this class. Shes cute and nice and always laughs. Its not hard to pay attention in this class and I always found her easy to understand. Tests take some good studying for, but good class!!!

This woman is horrible. I emailed her at the beginning of the quarter to request she use powerpoint because no one could follow her, but she refused. Her tests are impossibly hard, the class average was D I'm pretty sure. Over 200 slides of artwork to remember, plus 200 vocab. She has a very annoying voice. She's just evil. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!
Not a very good lecturer but easy assignments make up for that fact.
